content.label: If you are a fan of big band style jazz, the soundtrack alone deserves five star rating. Gameplay was fun too but i really love the musicians involved in this gem. Rip Simon.
Sound comletely broken.  Not worth the price.

title.label: Honestly one of the best storylines out there

content.label: I really love these characters and want to find out what happens next. Chapter 2 is quite a bit longer than chapter 1. I’m hoping chapter 3 will be long as well. I never pay full price for games, but I will for this one.

I loved how different the graphics and fun elements of this story game are from most other point & click games. It was a perfect difficulty for someone who plays these types of games often. Thank you for the originality!

title.label: Loved it! But the sounds didn’t work

content.label: I loved this game but the sound never worked while I was playing. I tried uninstalling and reinstalling, but that didn’t work ):
Arts, dialogs, music, atmosphere... absolutely great. 100% recommending to fans of point n click.
High quality graphics,sound, story, puzzles but mainly lots of fun.  Love the characters.  Sorry to hear about Mr Souza... Great soundtrack.

Beautifully put together game with fabulously rich characters with accents from Jamaica, Africa, Deep South in US, and a swabby who doesn’t seems quite sure if he’s an Aussi or a Cockney! Love it! The scenes are so atmospheric and the jazzy background music perfect. I really appreciate the different approach to the character creation, some with African Masks for faces, some with robotic faces, and maybe even marionnettes. It lends an air of other worldliness to the story yet the characters have all the humor and idiosyncrasies of humans.

If you were disappointed with the length of chapter 1, don’t worry, this one is MUCH longer. Chapter 2 offers more of the amazing Afro-noir game design, funky jazz soundtrack, and hilariously eccentric characters that made the 1st chapter so unique and fantastic and I loved every minute of it. I do wish enola’s house of butterflies was still a playable area though, it sounds pretty amazing 😉

Very smooth mobile version, not a clumsy, hastily put together port in any way. This adventure is also a graphically beautiful homage to West African culture. 🎭 

This game has fully-voiced characters, tastefully mature humor, and puzzles that will have gamers roaming around the lovely, yet gritty, scenes searching for clues for hours (talk to everyone, exhaust the dialogue choices, and return for new information occasionally). 

My only complaint is that it takes time to produce such clever games, and I am impatiently awaiting the next installment. 😡
PS. Please developers update game for iOS 10 per Apple request so game will continue to work on future iOS generations
Its an awesome game. Please make chap 3 fast!!

This is a great game with interesting story, smooth animation, fantastic music, and nifty puzzles (though last one is rather difficult). 

Please finish the story with Chapter 3!
Annoying accents, inane dialogue, stupid storyline unless you are 12. DELETE.

Monkey island good, Nuff said,Well maybe not the originals, but at least as good as the newer tales of monkey island series.
 Only thing I can fault is the wait time between episodes, and I'm still waiting damnit.
 I realize that there is a lot of work that goes into these things, but damnitall Were still waiting!

I only gave it a 3 because I felt it was a little overpriced at $7 for what it delivered. I feel like it was easier than the first one, so it didn't take me very long to finish. Still, the graphics are great and was fun for the short time it lasted.

title.label: If you are a point and click fan, you got to play this

content.label:
Kudos to the team!

- a Grim Fandango fan :)
If you like point and click adventure games with a sense of humor get this game!
I love this type of game and can't wait to find out what happens next in the story.

As a huge fan of point-and-click adventures, I was extremely pleased to play the second chapter of The Journey Down. The production values of this game are quite amazing throughout, and I found it to be a marked improvement over the first chapter, which was already among the most enjoyable point-and-click games of recent memory.

The puzzle design of TJD2 is at all times quite logical. Though this can be interpreted as the puzzles leanining towards the easier end of the spectrum, I found it refreshing that I didn't have to go off and google solutions to anything because of some unreasonable, sideways logic on the part of the designers; I can't even say that of the old Lucasarts adventures. For my tastes, I really could've been challenged a bit more by many of the puzzles, but I'm also something of a seasoned adventure game player. Again, I far prefer sane if simple puzzle design over being cruelly and frustratingly taunted by some sadistic designer hellbent on torturing me until I give in and download a walkthrough.

I feel SkyGoblin was pretty careful to include just the right amount of storyline exposition with TDJ2, which I'm certain wasn't an easy balance to strike, given the rather exotic narrative of the game. The result is a rather well-paced game which hums along quite nicely. When cutscenes occur, they ooze polish and are of the correct length and focus. Individual lines of dialogue may be skipped at a tap, and quick travel between locations is, mercifully, as easy as a double-tap on the exit arrows, allowing for the rapid travel through the game world that everyone REALLY wants from their adventure games.

The art and music here are quite memorable and special. Both the audio and visual design of TJD2 lovingly evoke shades of Grim Fandango. The cast of characters here is impressively large and well-voiced, and it seems the team really went above and beyond to make the game feel fully fleshed-out, recording unique lines of dialogue for just about any action the player could think to take. This saved me from hearing the same stock lines way too often when my attempted solutions to puzzles weren't quite right.

Overall, TJD2 was shorter than any of the old Lucasarts adventures, but good bit longer than, say, an episode from a Telltale game. I felt the game to be of an appropriate length, as it is only one of three chapters composing a much larger whole. I think the coming third and final chapter of The Journey Down will wrap things up in just about the perfect length of time for the story SkyGoblin is telling, and I simply can't wait to play it the moment it comes out.
This is literally the best game i have ever played from the app store!! Cant wait for number 3!!!
I can't wait for chapter three!

I've played a lot of p&c games through the years and "The Room1&2" have always been at the top for intellect, graphics, 'can't put it down' factor, but "TJD2" is INCREDIBLE!!! The story is intriguing and well written, the gameplay flows like no other games I've played. With the hold & hover process the game has, it's a game that is challenging but not so that you end up having to read a walkthru to complete, and you never loose interest in the story. I thought the price was a little steep at first compared to other P&C games but after playing TJD2 I would have paid twice the amount.  I hope a part 3 is on the way.
Chapter two is just as entertaining as chapter one, and I found the artwork to be even more impressive with this chapter.  I'm looking forward to chapter three's release.
If you liked the old Lucas Arts point and click adventure games you will love the journey down!  In ant wait for chapter 3 to be released!

title.label: Much longer and more interesting than the first

content.label: Chapter 2 makes buying the bundle worth while.  Don't expect to get an ending though - they are currently seeking funding for chapter 3.

I bought the 2 chapter bundle. I was not so impressed with chapter 1 (gave it 3 stars), but since I already bought chapter 2... Happily chapter 2 is well worth the price of the bundle by far. I really got drawn in and there is plenty of game play. I loved the graphics and the fact that places/people change throughout the game so you don't keep searching the same things in the same places. I wish I could silence the music, but I enjoyed the voice overs too much to mute my iPad Air 2.
An engrossing continuation of what made the first game awesome -- good story, inspired setting and visuals, highly likable characters, fun gameplay! 10/10 would point n click again

Couldn't put it down!  I can't wait for the next episode. It's like King's Quest meets 2015, and is directed at those of us who played old point and click adventures! Can't wait to see what else they come out with. This is my first review on any app. Couldn't resist sharing. Well done guys!
Cool environment. Great music. Nice noir feel. A bit clunky in animation, and plot is a bit hard to follow if played sporadically, but still fun.

At first, I was reluctant to buy chapter 1, but when I did, I fell in love with the game and immediately purchases chapter 2. Very well crafted, great voice actors, stunning graphics and music that perfectly fit the environment. Still waiting for chapter 3 though, because I'm really excited to explore St. Armondo and see Sabo and Makena again! So buy it now!

title.label: More Than Lives Up to my Expectations

content.label: I got the first chapter free, and after playing through it, I was more than willing to pay the full price for this chapter. This game is worthy of Steam (and it is on there) and works beautifully on iPhone. The tap mechanic works really well, the voice acting is convincing and doesn't come off as cheesy, and the puzzles really take some thought. There are a couple times they come across as a bit unintuitive, but those times are far outweighed by the sheer excellence of the rest of the game. Keep it up guys!

Thanks to the beautiful graphic, nice sound background and  engaging story it's the most original adventure I've ever played. Big recommend to all. People who made it, made it with passion and thats why this game looks soooo well.
Are they ever going to make a part 3 to this story?
While looking for something like the classic Grim Fandango, I came across this and was thoroughly surprised! Very addicting and enjoyable!
One of the best games ever. When will 3 be available?
The best games i've ever played !! Can't wait for chapter 3 😁😁

This is one of the best games I've ever played, on any platform/device/computer.  The music and ambiance are amazing. This is one of those games that's like a great, rich cup of espresso in a quiet coffeehouse or like immersing oneself in a hot tub on a cold night -- sweet and sensuous.  The storyline is engrossing, the puzzles make sense, ( though I admit I consulted a walkthrough site when I got stuck a few times.  Great voice acting, diverse and engaging characters, excellent navigation.  I can't say enough good things about this game.  I'm just sad it's over!  I am usually a cheapskate on games but when Ch 3 comes out, I will pay what it costs (but please have mercy and don't make it ten bucks or something).

I haven't paid for a game in probably over a year, but I'm glad I did. It is so awesome for a point and click adventure game to exist in 2015. If you like point and click, get this. I can't wait for the next chapter!

Another fine chapter in this series - bests the already-great first chapter. Engrossing story, fun characters, great design, and an outstanding soundtrack (RIP Simon D'Souza). Can't wait for Chapter Three!

I am very upset. This game was amazing!  It is like a revival of the adventure Monkey Island.  I am sad that I have completed chapter 2 and chapter 3 has not been released. The game was high in price but after playing the game I realize it is a bargain. Great graphics, storyline, and puzzles are intuitive and not so obscure they are impossible to solve. If I had three thumbs I would give it three thumbs up.

The Journey Down chapter 1 was great. It had excellent art and sound design as Bwana traveled to interesting areas of the city.  Journey Down chapter 2 excels even further. The soundtrack is a fuller sounding band and the locations are varied and beautiful. This time around, the puzzles are also very logical and clever. They never get frustrating and always made me feel smart. I can't wait for the next chapter in this awesome series.

title.label: Great game - storyline rich and engaging

content.label: Best game I've played in awhile.  Similar to classic point and clicks but fantastic design and interface.  Funny engaging story and puzzles are the perfect level of challenging without becoming frustrating.  Plays 1 & 2 and can't wait for the final chapter. Please make more games like this!

I love this game! I'm "thrifty" and rarely find a game i'm willing to pay full price for, but this one hit the spot. After playing the first chapter, I couldn't wait for chapter 2. I'll replay a couple of times while waiting for chapter 3. Great job, guys!

I'm an old adventure fan and truly belief that TJD1 and 2 are the best games after Lucasfilm stopped making such gems. The story is funny and interesting, graphics and music are truly remarkable. I recommend a headset to fully enjoy the sound. Looking forward to more. $5 very well invested. R.I.P. Simon. A true fan.
Amazing game much like the classic point click adventure games from Lucasarts.  I hope these guys remake Day of The Tentacle.
I really enjoyed this game, one of those apps that you know was developed from the heart. Great story, puzzles, music, characters & voices. 5 stars and keep those chapters coming!!
Keep them coming!  Gd job!
Its an awesome point and click adventure!! Buy it already!!

title.label: A book you can't put down

content.label: I just finished and all I can say is wow! I was so engrossed from start to finish. The story gets better and better while the atmosphere is wonderful. Its also all so fresh and original.
